page.title: 01Bernice Glen & Loch Eck
page.content: Steep sided hills rising up either side of Lock Eck. Bernice Glen is a short steep sided valley heading west from Lock Eck. On both sides of the loch mature plantations of mainly spruce are growing. There are also areas of natural broadleaved woodland such as oak & birch. The hill tops consist of very poor quality sheep grazing. The whole area is owned by the forestry commission. The main road runs down the east side of Lock Eck. The area is very sparsely populated, with only a few houses occupied.
